item.title: Experimental Design
item.description: In the book Encyclopedia of Behavioral Medicine, Turner describes experimental design from a clinical perspective “as an experiment with a series of observations made under conditions in which the influences of interest are controlled by the research scientist”, Turner, 2013. The randomized trial is the classic example of experimental design. The data is randomized to one of two or more experimental groups. Then the significant differences between the sets are analyzed.
